Job Title: Production Supervisor

Location: Cleveland, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Embark on a career with our esteemed client, a front-runner in crafting cutting-edge products and solutions for the global foundry industry. They are seeking a dynamic and skilled Production Supervisor to be a pivotal force in their rapidly expanding team.Purpose: The Production Supervisor is responsible for the daily operation of all production, quality, paperwork, and maintenance in the Manufacturing, Quality, and Warehouse areas. This self-motivated individual has the responsibility to direct employees by using experience and knowledge of production methods, processes, equipment, safe practices, and total quality to achieve continuous improvements. The ideal candidate for this collaborative role will contribute to shift coverage through involvement in process analysis, handling material and product disposition, managing non-conforming elements, and driving continuous improvement in process quality.Key Result Areas:Create and promote a safe working environment in all departments by actively participating in safety audits, submission, and implementation of safety improvement ideas, and upholding corporate safety standards.Supervise available equipment and personnel to optimize efficiency and produce scheduled parts per the agreed upon timeframe.Oversee that all processes are clearly and thoroughly defined in documented procedures and that all hourly operators are effectively trained to follow these procedures.Verify test results obtained by production operators for any quality defects.Through close monitoring of daily area activity, ensure that all operations are completed per procedures so that resulting product meets all required quality standards. Perform periodic audits of production activities and finished product quality.Play key role in the overall plant improvement program – work closely with Quality group to highlight preventative and corrective actions that lead to continuous improvement in yields.Work with the maintenance department and key operators, to ensure all critical equipment is properly serviced and maintained to optimize efficiency.Any other tasks as assigned by management.Qualifications:4-year degree or an equivalent combination of 2-year professional certifications and experience preferred.Continuous improvement program experience such as 5S and Lean manufacturing experience preferred.Minimum of 3 years’ experience within a manufacturing environmentMust be familiar with total quality and continuous improvement methods within a manufacturing and/or warehouse environment.Understanding of how to drive performance improvement across working groups to achieve high performanceAdept in data capture and measurement of cycle time, line capacity, TOC.Computer applications, Lean, quality standards and auditing.Demonstrated ability in critical analysis.Prime Management Group Inc. will be accepting resumes from candidates, in confidence. For more information about the role, please contact Brian Small, at 248-457-5538 or brians@pmg.on.ca

Experience Level (if available): None
